abstract.para: Vertical profiles of temperature, pH, alkalinity, dissolved oxygen, ammonia, nitrate, sulfate, and methane for the fertilized side of Lake N-2 during 1990.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The fertilized side of Lake N-2.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: March91 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 4Oct91

para.literalLayout: Water samples were collected with a Van Dorn Bottle or a pump. Dissolved oxygen was measured by Winkler titration. Alkalinity was determined by acid titration to an end point of 4.8. Sulfate measurements were made using ion chromatography. Ammonia and nitrate were determined using flow injection colorimetric methods. Temperature measured with a mercury thermometer. Methane was measured by gas chromatography.

Reference Citations: Some alkalinity and pH data was used in Kling et al. 1991. Arctic lakes and streams as gas conduits to the atmosphere: implications for tundra carbon budgets. Science 251:298-301.
